game_description: üèÜ Winner: D.I.C.E. Awards - Immersive Reality Game of the Year üèÜ Winner: D.I.C.E. Awards - Immersive Reality Techincal Achievement üèÜ Winner: RoadToVR - Meta Quest Game of the Year üèÜ Winner: UploadVR - Best VR Developer üèÜ Nominee: The Game Awards - Best VR/AR Red Matter 2 is a one-of-a-kind immersive puzzle-adventure game that takes you on a heart-pumping journey to the far reaches of space in a dystopian cold war setting. Step into the shoes of Sasha, an agent awakened in a lunar base by an undercover operative and tasked with uncovering the secrets of the mysterious Red Matter. As you explore visually stunning Volgravian bases and experience a spine-chilling atmosphere, you'll be challenged with mind-bending puzzles, fast-paced combat, and platforming mechanics that will keep you on the edge of your seat. With the help of your hacking tool and jetpack, you'll have the freedom to soar through the skies and move without limits as you navigate your way through the world. Uncover the secrets of this fully-realized world as you solve environmental, physics, and logic puzzles and hack into terminals to gain access to vital information. But be prepared for the unexpected, as Volgravia has taken great measures to protect the secrets you seek. Explore a fully interactive world designed to enhance the feeling of immersion in virtual reality. Red Matter 2 is the ultimate VR adventure, and a must-play for anyone looking for a thrilling, impactful, and unforgettable experience.
Languages: English, Chinese (China), French (France), German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese (Brazil), Spanish (Spain)
review_1: I was blown away by the magnificent story and the incredible graphics. The story is compelling and had me hooked since the first 5 minutes. I was awed by the textures, physics, and lighting; how did they get this to run so smoothly on quest? Beats me. This is by far one of, if not, the best story games on the oculus store. It took me about 4 or 5 hours to complete. The puzzles are not too complex and not too simple. The combat was surprisingly well polished, I enjoyed ending the lives of those annoying drones. Great job devs! Scratch that, spectacular job. I would highly recommend this game. -TeaSiri

review_4: It was an incredible journey. There's puzzles, stealth, action, platforming and adventure. The game length was pretty decent too. The last fight took me quite a few times to get through, but not much grind besides that. Enough challenge for me. I do wish there would have been more easter eggs. :)
review_5: I just recently finished Red Matter and thought it was fantastic, then I started Red Matter 2. In every way they made this sequel better. Graphically astonishing. Physics are awesome. You grab a document to examine it, and it bends and folds. Jet pack and movement are vastly improved. There are items that are throw backs to the original game. Your interaction with this new world has same mechanics as the first game , with a couple new things and better. This game imo, has set the bar for any type of sequel. If you thought Red Matter was fantastic, wait until you step into Red Matter 2.
